thread.title: Why there was a 'B ks to Brexit' bus at Monument today

author: Chris Knight
title: Why there was a 'B ks to Brexit' bus at Monument today
text:
News Why there was a 'B ks to Brexit' bus at Monument today The bright yellow campaign bus emblazoned with the message "B ks to Brexit" was parked in the shadow of Grey's Monument in Newcastle Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Get daily updates directly to your inbox Subscribe Thank you for subscribing We have more newsletters Show me See our privacy notice Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email
Anti-Brexit campaigners demanding a second referendum on EU membership have paid a visit to Newcastle.
The bright yellow campaign bus emblazoned with the message "B ks to Brexit" was parked in the shadow of Grey's Monument on Wednesday morning.
The grassroots movement calling for a people's vote paid a visit to Tyneside having already stopped at 50 cities in the UK and Ireland.
Campaign spokeswoman Madeleina Kay - dubbed #EUsupergirl - claims the "bold and provocative" slogan is designed to engage people in the debate.
She said: "If you've had enough of Brexit , if you are sick of hearing about, if you think the negotiations have been a disaster, then we need to stop it. Read More Jeremy Corbyn tables motion of no confidence in Theresa May The B s to Brexit bus at Monument (Image: newcastle chronicle)
"The repercussions of Brexit is going to impact negatively on our economy and our society for years if not decades.
"We believe passionately on this bus that people need to take back control of the process from the politicians who have lied to us, who have deceived us, who have made a mess of our country, and we need to demand a final say on the Brexit deal." The B s to Brexit bus attracts the attention of police and traffic wardens at Monument (Image: newcastle chronicle)
